intro: Scorzonera fengtiensis, commonly known as the Fengtian scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Compositae (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Scorzonera fengtiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
